website_summaries.verdict: The Samson Z55 Professional Reference headphones deliver an accurate, impressive sound signature, ideal for studio work and home listening.
pros: Excellent balance of lows and highs in a sound signature that strives for accuracy and vibrancy
cons: Could be a bit more comfortable

customer_reviews.title: Great, Studio Quality Sound, at a BARGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality form these headphones is absolutely fantastic. This is no questions asked studio quality sound and a cracking price. Comfort wise, these do the job, but, as I have done, I would recommend replacing the earpads as they can get uncomfortable after an hour or so. Brainwavz Round pads are excellent for this. If I have one other gripe about these, it's the non-detachable cable, however at this low a price point, you really cannot grumble. I would get another pair of these again in a heartbeat. Did this help you? Please consider marking this as 'Helpful' below, it would be much, much appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: Henry G

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: The first thing you notice when you open these headphones and pull them from the box is the weight. They are VERY light and whilst this might sound like they would be comfortable to wear, they've been designed (and sold) as high-quality well-made headphones. They're not. The second thing is the ear pads. These are more like pieces of polystyrene covered in fuzzy felt, than soft velour over soft foam. This was the main reason I bought these, for comfort. Disappointed. Good thing they were cheap. Once they break - and it probably won't take long, I'll go in-store and try out something genuinely professional.
customer_reviews.author: ATG1977

customer_reviews.title: They go on your head.
customer_reviews.text: I decided I wanted a pair of headphones for my amateur radio. When they arrived the packaging was a bit so so When I took them out they lacked a quality feeling to them and the plastic seemed lightweight and cheap. However they seem to have a reasonable sound and the headband adjusts easily for a good fit. They cover my ears well. So... not disappointed with the performance & fit but the construction is a bit light.
customer_reviews.author: Jonno D

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound - brilliant price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones as a bit of an experiment really... how did they compare to an old pair of Sony (not sure what model)? Well, I was pretty bowled over. They present a well balanced flat clear sound which makes listening through them a pleasure. I’ve listened to various genres from folk to rock, and the Samson SR850 headphones handle it all with ease. I’ve also used them to mix music, and this is where they really come to life. Without colouring the sound, they make mixing music far less taxing providing a nice separation between instrument frequencies. Definitely buy these... at less than £30 why would you not try them?
customer_reviews.author: Jiminuk

customer_reviews.title: Broke after just 31 days of infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good, ears do get a bit hot when wearing. None of this matters though as one of the plastic sliding parts snapped just from me casually placing the headphones on my head, after a month of hardly using them. I have small head too, they're nearly too big for me to use so it's not like they were stretched, quite the opposite. Cheap junk, avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Stuey Gibsualdo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pair of headphones given the price. Use them for listening to music and focus during work - you can wear them for hours without feeling uncomfortable. The are very light and soft and sit comfortably around the head and ears. Also use them in home recording environment - they are great for this setup too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ohrstrom

customer_reviews.title: really uncomfortable honestly.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these as i dont like leather earcups as they make your ears sweaty, but the foam is so firm it just hurts your ears instantly. couldnt wear them for more than 5-10 mins without being in agony. i dont have sticky out ears, they are really flat to my head. Sound quality was fine, but eith comfrot level like that? No thanks. Returned after 20 mins. Ive tried dozens of other headsets, never has such an ill fitting painful headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Gooding

customer_reviews.title: Sound is excellent. Comfort is not.
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these is exceptional for the money. They punch well above their weight for sound clarity and mids/highs are great with the bass a little too weak to my ears. My only criticism would be that the headband was quite tight and didn't sit well on my head despite various adjustments and the earpads can get quite warm/sweaty with prolonged use. Sound: excellent for the money. Build-quality is ok but comfort and fit-ear may not suit everyone and can be quite tight and uncomfortable after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: So horribly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones in January to use with my digital piano - as it happened I didn't actually need to use them until last week. Whilst the sound quality for piano is really very satisfying, I thought on first look that the "self-adjusting" headband might be a weak spot. When the first side snapped clean off on the second use, and then the other side on the third use, I was proved right. My return window has now closed, and I'm out £26 and without a usable set of headphones. So upsetting. When I can afford to I shall buy something better quality.
customer_reviews.author: H D Inglis

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones for mixing, mastering and music production.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good pair of budget monitor headphones for when I am working on soundtrack music and decided to give these a go and to my surprise they are actually very very good, comfortable to wear and the sound is crisp, very dynamic, bassy lows but not overly as often you find with budget headphones the bass can be quite "drowning" but not with these, very good balance between lows, mids and highs. I definitely recommend these if you're looking for an exceptional pair of headphones with great sound quality, not just for monitoring but for general use as well and not only that, they look good too!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain headphones that punch well above it's weight!
customer_reviews.text: I was very sceptical when I bought these headphones, due to the low price. I wanted them specifically for gaming on my pc, as my cheap gaming headset was terrible. The build quality is great, good quantity materials and nice finish, they look much more expensive that their price tag. Soft ear pads and self adjusting strap made them very comfortable too. I was blown away with the sound quality, sharp clean tones, and great bass. Far better that my old gaming headset, and good enough for listening to my vinyl too. The only down side is no microphone, but a good stock on gaming mic is an easy fix. I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: BigBools

customer_reviews.title: Amazing low priced studio quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this headphone is similar to Superlux HD 668B, but better grip design meaning it is more comfortable to wear. Sound quality is amazing for the price (up to £100 mark) and it is definitely great for listening to all kind of music. It is tuned for Studio use so it is aiming at reproduction of the actual audio from tracks, rather than sweetening music. beware of the high ohm of this headphone although it works with my S10 5G phone well.
customer_reviews.author: But H.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at low price
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built, great sounding headphones at a bargain price. This was my first pair of studio type for use with home recording and mixing. What a difference they make to normal stereo headphones. Come well packaged and cable looks really thick and sturdy. Nice and comfy as well. Have worn for 2 hours solid on a warm day and no sweating issues. Definitely recommend these if you in the market for a decent pair at low price
customer_reviews.author: graham slater

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant bargain
customer_reviews.text: Bought on the strength of a rave review in Classical Music magazine, no less, which rated them at least as good as much more expensive options. I was not disappointed. Used them as monitor headphones for a week's TV work (classical music) -- reproduction very clear, comfortable to wear all day. Nice velvety bass and full tonal spectrum. Pro: quality, comfort, light weight, price, long kink-free cable. Con: level sometimes a bit low (but OK for most uses). Tinny treble at first while 'running in', but the reviews warned me about that. Bulkier to look at than they feel -- wouldn't want to wear them in public, e.g. on the tube!
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfy & perfect for any use for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm by no means an 'audio' expert but I bought these to replace some 4 year old on ear steelseries headphones & I have 0 complaints. The sound quality is perfectly good enough for whatever I've been doing, editing, watching videos, playing games. They're super comfy for wearing for long periods of time with velvet ear cups and being over ear. Great price & I'm really happy with these headphones and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Coles

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but expensive sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great value, sound great with lots of detail. You could pay more for better but you would have to spend another £50 - £100. I bought theses to listen from my bedside Echo Dot 3 clock. I did plug them into my hi end (ish) Flac music streamer and they sounded really good. Comfy, maybe a little tight, nice long cable fixed into left side so be careful not to damage the connection after a few months of pull and tug. No regrets and a no brained for £17.50 daily deal from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Whosphoto

customer_reviews.title: T
customer_reviews.text: They arrived in used condition, anyway they look rather plastic, have not heard like they sound because of the biohazard
customer_reviews.author: Ra

customer_reviews.title: Great sound lousy fit
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm pleasantly surprised by these headphones,the bass and treble response is crisp and clear with virtually no muddiness, they sound way better then headphones costing 4 x more. However 1 star off for the extremely uncomfortable fit which can very soon irritate your ears. If you made the head band adjustment better you would have a real winner.
customer_reviews.author: cosmic3

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic VFM
customer_reviews.text: I feel compelled to write a review because I've had these for three years now and they sound great, comfortable to wear with an open sound that takes the harshness from the high end without dulling it to the point of imprecison. Great Value if like me you'd rather not wear your expensive headphones when cycling or other activities.
customer_reviews.author: platosdunce

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphones with decent bass and very clean highs. Only problem I have is wearing glasses! I find I need to take the glasses off, put the headphones on then put my glasses back on! Overall very nice product, well made with velour ear pads so hopefully wont fall apart like the plastic leather effect ones do. Decent cable length with what feels like good quality cable. Very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cogger

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Budget Earphones
customer_reviews.text: Great set of Headphones - Pro's- -These headphones are surprisingly light. -The Drivers in these headphones are awesome - passed every bass and treble test i could throw at them. -Vocals are beautiful. -comfy ear padding. Cons - - Ear pads get quite sweaty -Wire is a tad bit long - could of been coiled somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: Matty Longden

customer_reviews.title: Insanely Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed to find that these headphones were so cheap. They are my first open-backed headphones, bought them as I've heard they're a good type of headphone for gaming and music alike. However though, as brilliant as they are they lack premium build quality, which is fine because they are sturdy. With that being said, the build quality falls short on comfort, they don't have a good clamping pressure and feel very rigid. When all is said and done, for the price you pay you can't really go wrong. Easily could pay over £100 for headphones that aren't as impressive in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, great sounding headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great cheap pair of headphones, the sound quality is excellent for the price you pay but don't expect the same of the build quality. Pros - Great sounding Comfortable Cheap Long lead Adaptor included Simple packaging Cons - Poor build quality (hard plastics and sharp material on headband) but what do you expect for less than £20? Non detachable cable I would definitely recommend these, for casual listening and listening for long periods, they also work very well for gaming as they have a fairly good soundstage.
customer_reviews.author: NC08

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable sound clarity
customer_reviews.text: I defy anyone to get clearer sound for the money. Supremely comfortable. These aren't your childish overly bassy headphones. They can give strong clear bass without going muddy, it's only there when it NEEDS to be. They also manage this without being tinny. Crystal clear everything, bottom, mid & high (cliche I know but it's true!)
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Typos in the owner's manual probably means this item is a fake...
customer_reviews.text: I am confused, I bought these so called 'open back headphones' but in the manual it says they are 'semi-open back headphones' is this the same thing? My main grips is that I have spotted a number of typos on page 2 of the owner's manual which leads me to think the product is a fake... I have quickly tested out the audio as I require this for mixing, music so clarity is essential, and to be fair it does sound pretty good, but I am just not sure if this is the real deal or not now or not...
customer_reviews.author: matthew williams

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for long periods of gaming sessions
customer_reviews.text: So i use these headphones with Behringer U-PHORIA UM2 Computer Audio Interface but it will work great on normal PC ports. I am not a person who likes overhear headphone but these still have small air from the outside and i cant hear my heartbeat with them on which is the reason why i don't like over hear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Coulthard

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality- especially at this price. Not a stylish product, and the plastics do feel cheap to touch, but then again, who really cares in studio headphones- the good sound quality is what matters. Give a good reference sound. If that's what you want they're highly recommended, or even for more leisure listening. I wouldn't recommend them if you think Beats are great though.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and sound amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These are gems for the price, I have tried countless different headphones around this price range, including the ATH m20x, and nothing comes close to the comfort or the sound quality of these. At first I was worried due to the semi open back nature of the headphones that my mic would pick up noise from the headphones but there is surprisingly little noise leakage while having a wide sound stage. The sound is amazing, as said previously the sound stage is amazing and there is a distinct v shape and its done very well with great bass and crisp but not harsh highs which works great with the sound stage.
customer_reviews.author: Dibya

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for anyone other than the bassiest of bass junkies
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. However, like most headphones in this price range, they have a weak spot. Normally it is the treble or mids that suffer but in these the bass can be a bit distorted and crackly at times. I'm looking at you, "islands" by the xx. Fortunately these were purchased as a present and the intended recipient listens mostly to classical. These sound great for that purpose and are a real gem of a find for anyone other than bass junkies. I purchased mine from Amazon and, as the box states, and as pictured, they do come with velour cups.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hazlett

customer_reviews.title: Professional audio, amateur pricing
customer_reviews.text: Well what to say, after trying various more expensive pairs of branded headphones, trying to find something suitable to use for production until I could afford “proper” reference headphones, I took a punt on these. Where all the others had a heavily unbalanced sound- overdriven bass- flat mid- tinny top, the drivers in these are flawless, especially for the money. Cannot recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Decent budget headset
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend as her old headset is now resting in pieces. Comfortable, sounds reasonable for the price, design is 'ok'. Can't fault much, but obviously you can tell not an expensive headset.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for price!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, rather comfortable, and can’t believe the sound quality for the price. Highly recommend! IMO these are better than the Audio Technica ATH-50x (which I also have). I bought these for reference as they’re open-back and now considering selling my Audio Technicas because these are so good. Only downside really is they feel cheap, maybe a little TOO lightweight, and the pads are not so soft but they fit well, I wear them for hours on end with no problem. They are very clear and have great frequency response, great for electronic music production.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: good for the price, Wire is not durable
customer_reviews.text: the sound quality of these headphones are good for its price point. There are a few products that rival it at this price point that you might want to look into. my main concern with the headphone is that the wire is not detachable and i found my cable to not be as durable as i wanted. My pair only lasted about 3 months before I started to hear defects with my unit (e.g when i turned my head a certain degree the left ear would not play any sound) until around the 4-5 month mark where the left side of the headphones completely stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: frim

customer_reviews.title: Really rate these!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with these as a 'cheap' alternative to more pricier options. Having mixed on these for a couple of weeks, I was dubious about how my mixed would sound on my Dynaudio monitors... there's always the tendency to add more bass to headphone mixes - gotta say, they were absolutely spot on. No ear fatigue or fitting issues... not sure what the net,-sayers are on about. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Skewy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, comfy and good value
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by the value for money here. First set of open-back headphones I've owned and not disappointed. Lets in a good amount of sound from the environment (which is what I wanted) and puts far less pressure on your ears during long listening sessions. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, powerful, wavering, headcrushing
customer_reviews.text: Great soundstage but with a weird tendency to vary the volume. Comfortable pads made better if you turn them inside out, but really clamps onto my XL head to the point of pain by hour 2. Excellent for ps4 gaming and movies, great for music and podcasts, just keep some paracetamol closeby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheap,comfortable,great sounding
customer_reviews.text: so i bought these as i wasnt happy with the comfort of my mx40 headphones and surprisingly these sound just as good as those headphones that cost double the price, the velour ear cups are comfortable and not too hot when wearing
customer_reviews.author: C. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these while looking for a cheap set of headphones for my office PC and am more than happy with the quality for the price I paid. Great sound quality, nice bass which isn't too overpowering and the design feels comfortable after wearing them for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value over ear, open backed, headphones. Bought these a month ago simply to listen to music at home and have not been disappointed with their quality of reproduction. Comfortable to wear with tight bass, open midrange and crisp treble. I actually prefer the sound balance of the SR850s to that of my son's £200 headphones! The Samsons are unlikely to win any design awards but do offer maximum performance at minimal price. Well worth an audition!
customer_reviews.author: Ctop

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was previously using the hyperx cloud 2, but decided to try these out after them dying on me and I am not disappointed, the sound is great, they are extremely light and comfortable. Ear pads are comfy, self adjusting head set is great. Overall very impressed. Using for gaming perfect for escape from tarkov, fortnite and Cs.
customer_reviews.author: kieron burgess

customer_reviews.title: Bit un comfy but all round good earphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for almost a year now, I can wear these headphones for hours on end without them hurting or scratching my head - however I had to invert the ear muffs because they itched my ears a lot. Other than that these are a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alfie

customer_reviews.title: terrible, just TERRIBLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Crappy plastic rubbish, I play keyboard and wanted something cheap and cheerful but got something BLAND AND CRAP!!!...stay away these are headphones out of a Christmas cracker!!
customer_reviews.author: ;Scott McKay

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great but ...
customer_reviews.text: ... unfortunately you can't wear them for more than ten minutes before your ears feel like they're burning up. Need some airflow or something Maybe they are OK in the winter in a cold room.
customer_reviews.author: blink

customer_reviews.title: Convinced myself that these were Audio Technica £80 headphones, didn’t think to double check until now! How wrong I was!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these back in June 2015, used them regularly, between 2-5 days a week for a few hours each day since, and they’re just as good as when I got them. They’re an absolute steal at this price; I honestly forgot how much they were and even what brand they were, as I never paid much attention to the branding after a while. I was thinking they were Audio Technica and that I’d paid about £80 for them! Amazingly sturdy and well made, very good sound quality, and incredibly comfortable! 5/5, can’t fault them one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Charlton

customer_reviews.title: Great headset for a bargain of a price
customer_reviews.text: The headset has great sound quality for the price. Music, movies and games all sound great, the headset itself is comfortable even over long periods of time, the cable is very long which makes it easy to use no matter your setup and the headset comes with a 6.35mm adaptor for anybody with an Amp or keyboard. Overall 100% recommend these headphones, especially if you can get them for the price they originally where and what i got them for (£36).
customer_reviews.author: Canopus

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very good, I initially thought there was no 3.5mm jack until I found out the tip screws off the 6.35mm jack to make it 3.5mm so don't make the same mistake as me I would recommend the company makes this clearer as I found out by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Super Hans

customer_reviews.title: Poor performer with budget construction
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for such a cheaply constructed and poorly sounding headphones - not studio quality by a long shot - probably performing at the £10-15 level - in fact I have some £14 Bluetooth over ear headphones that are much much better
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: RINGSIDE SEAT?
customer_reviews.text: After 40 years of listening to various media, I have become an expert on the quality of mid-priced stereo headphones (none really bad), but these simply stun! Have just listened to a Jean-Michel Jarre CASSETTE (1981, played on a Sony Professional WM) and the SASR850Cs dug-up stuff I never knew existed - par excellence. Unbelievable separation and f/response - therefore stupendous value. You must buy - at this price you SHALL buy this item. Very solid, comfy fit - a bit like having an armchair in the auditorium itself...
customer_reviews.author: steamrecordist

customer_reviews.title: but these are a great upgrade from your typical cheap headphones (even the cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile, but these are a great upgrade from your typical cheap headphones (even the cheap ones from Sony). They do have a couple of spikes at certain frequencies, for example when listening to a sine wave, like the test sounds on youtube. And I had to turn down the highs, as they were tiring.

customer_reviews.title: Not mind blowingly good
customer_reviews.text: These headphones deliver a competent performance. They just don't bring the music to life as well as more expensive Grado's, Sennheiser's etc. But for the price, they are good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: Slight harshness in higher frequencies but overall excellent sound. Behaves like a monitor. Transparent sound. Excellent value for the money. Holds its own against other good headphones like Sennheiser 600 and Beyerdynamic 777 pro. But not anywhere near the Stax Sigma.
customer_reviews.author: ayurmonk

customer_reviews.title: Good value and very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money. A little bassy for mixing but good sound quality overall for the price. Extremely comfortable, flocked ear pads.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Piers A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: beats my hyper x revolver headset for 1/5 of the ...
customer_reviews.text: beats my hyper x revolver headset for 1/5 of the price i would get ths over a gaming headset
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Brit Gaming

customer_reviews.title: A no-brainer purchase for mixing!
customer_reviews.text: If you're mixing on a budget, these are phenomenal! Ridiculously clear, and feel pretty neutral (no overloading on the bass). I use this on Cubase, through a Focusrite audio interface, and I can pick out every detail/artefact in my mixes. A no-brainer purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MikeyMoo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace my ageing AKGs and only just started using them. The sound quality is good across the frequency range, certainly good enough for rough mixing when you don't want to make too much noise. They are also very comfortable, I've been wearing them for long sessions with no issues. Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are excellent for the price. I am not an audiophile, but I find them just as good as my Senehiesers.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I originally bought some AKG K92’s and returned them the same day. They were throaty and had very little bass. These however are much better with a tighter sound. I use them for recording my guitar and mixing at home.
customer_reviews.author: derekj

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but bass frequencies not well represented
customer_reviews.text: Very good set of headphones, especially for music creators. The bass could be improved and if worn for extended periods it can start to hurt a little, however I can’t complain because the headphones are great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Compounds of Copper

customer_reviews.title: Great cans man
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic low priced reference headphones. A nice flat frequency response, which is what you need when mixing. I've mixed a few songs using these Samson SR850's And the results were better than expected when played back though monitors. Really comfy to wear for long sessions and the clarity of the frequencies is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: BOBBAR

customer_reviews.title: Great, nice and flat sounding
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, sounds good and flat, though get a little uncomfortable if worn for hours at a time, but most headphones do. But very happy
customer_reviews.author: Mmachine

customer_reviews.title: I was blown away by the clarity and transparency of ...
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by the clarity and transparency of these. I use them for tracking drums and mixing. Only £30 seems almost too cheap. Would be worth getting another pair before they go up in price.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: You can definitely hear the difference. Had to take them to a friends because he could not hear the defects in his recording on the domestic headphones he was using.
customer_reviews.author: Guy_P

customer_reviews.title: Nice sounding headphones,few little tweaks needed
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones , the sound they produce is well balanced ,little bit bright, I did put round cotton pad in to ear cups , loads of details 8 of 10. Head band resonates a little bit so you must put little wire in a center at the top to ,give a bit a tension for those wire band links. Comfort is 9 of 10 depends on head shape:) ,quality wise they are ok and do look great.
customer_reviews.author: Rimantas

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding for the price, good sound, good bass. Not very comfortable with glasses but a minor complaint given their cost.
customer_reviews.author: I really do look like him

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, feel good (occasionally a bit warm on longer sessions and sound very good for the price - not quite as smooth as my Beyers but not far off. Good workhorse studio headphones
customer_reviews.author: David Walton

customer_reviews.title: The headphones sound good for the price but bear in mind the minimum ...
customer_reviews.text: The headphones sound good for the price but bear in mind the minimum size is larger than most other headphones, comparing to the photo in the ad my minimum headband height is much higher up. It is almost too big.
customer_reviews.author: owls

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously good headhphones. Had them for over 3 years, and they have been worn on a regular basis, but have maintained quality and durability during that time. The noise cancelling is fantastic, great for music and for gaming, and would say that the quality of them is comparative to high range headphones.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds at great price. Relax and enjoy your music as it should sound. Build your own headset by pairing with mic for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Sound good
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the price, not the most comfortable to wear for any length of time, sound quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: a t blunt

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but check plug size
customer_reviews.text: Good quality especially given the price. Beware the plug is the larger size and you will need the adapter to fit to your computer or in my case the back of the Samson microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems very good quality overall
customer_reviews.text: seems very good quality overall, I'd prefer a bit more depth to the sound but maybe it will get better by using it. They do get uncomfortable (even painful around the ears) after wearing them for 30+ minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Pro

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I little harsh on top end, but other than that I am surprised how good they are for the price.
customer_reviews.author: staserra

customer_reviews.title: like them, for the price
customer_reviews.text: like them, for the price. Not amazing bass naturally but will output it if you tweak equaliser. THey are advertised as reference so can't mark them down for that.
customer_reviews.author: Rartery

customer_reviews.title: High detail studio reference headphones for rock/vocals
customer_reviews.text: Extremely good resolution and detail; clarity and definitely studio worthy monitors. Very bright sound that’s not quite as suited for bass lovers or electronic music heads as some others but great for rock and vocals. Excellent value for money. Oh yes and really lovely velvet ear pads and sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: Max Van Kleek

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones for studio use great quality good at the price
customer_reviews.author: del shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Samson SASR850C Professional Headphones. Good Quality and Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I decided on the Samson SASR850C as they had good reviews and I also didnt want to spend massive money on something I may hate using. Found them to be comfortable with a good sound quality and spot on if you are on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Hewisenior

customer_reviews.title: Padding on one side came off and I'm unable to put it back on again.
customer_reviews.text: Happened around 4 1/2 months after purchase. The headphones are now too uncomfortable to wear. Would like a refund or replacement. Up until then I had been enjoying my experience. SQ is pretty good at such a price point.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great Feel, Good Sound.
customer_reviews.text: I wear headphones at work, i work in an office but often listen to music to drown our colleagues talking rubbish all day These are great - however they aren't truly closed backed so a lot of sound does escape from them. This isn't an issue for me as my volumes are always quite low. The sound quality is really good for a pair of stereo headphones - at this price point you won't get much better!
customer_reviews.author: Vivica

customer_reviews.title: these headphones are simply amazing. I am able to listen to music
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these headphones are simply amazing. I am able to listen to music, and to the audio from my video game in a whole new way. Excellent sound stage, giving good direction to sound. Big, comfortable cups. Very very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Haseeb

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable , good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very good from these for the price and great for the tv.The ear pads are very comfortable and very soft.
customer_reviews.author: Bonkers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones for gaming
customer_reviews.text: very good headphones, but the trebbles are very high (can be fixed by slightly reducing high ebd hz in the equalizer) but apparently this gets better after a good burn in anyway. great for gaming, soundstage is awesome and makes it easy to identify the location of gunshots/ footsteps etc.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Freaking awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I just got them and i have been listening to all my favorite songs with a new, much better sound(i did own a few other headsets at this price range, but so far this is the best).
customer_reviews.author: JbPr

customer_reviews.title: FRUITY LOOPS!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to for music production fruity loops. these are amazing. cant testify for longevity however. Open ear so cant really use on public transport etc but for home use 9/10. conisdering I have KRK speakers and these sound good its £30 well spent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself from spending on other brands
customer_reviews.text: Don’t spread hundreds on brands which are only a tad better than this.
customer_reviews.author: firesza

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound. Big earphones. I use equalizer also. This product schould be very expensive. I happy.
customer_reviews.author: jerry1532

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my home studio. As good as headphones twice the price. Sound is excellent. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: zedman37

customer_reviews.title: ᅩ
customer_reviews.text: I was really upset about this headset. First when I bought the headset, I quite enjoyed listening but, after a week only left side of the speaker worked. I tried to refund but it said That I had to have my code in the delivery box. Well thank you for wasting my money
customer_reviews.author: Minsup Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These are really honest headphones for mixing. The build quality is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant quality for its price. Build quality is very good. The foam around the ears isn't leather so it doesn't make you sweat/gather too much dead skin which would otherwise build up, especially in the summer. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Woooah - the quality is fantastic. I'm massively into audio and believe I have a keen ear. These sound great and the auto adjusting arch make these very comfortable to wear. Same quality as £100-£150 headphones in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: dash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget headphones for studio work
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones to use for recording, mixing and mastering music. I was hopeful from the reviews that these were going to be at least half decent but at the price I truly didn't have the highest of expectations. I was pleasantly surprised in the end. These headphones are so much more transparent than any other headphones I've ever used, although I will admit to only ever having consumer rather than reference headphones prior to this set. For the price, I really don't think you can go wrong with these even if it is for general music consumption rather than creation.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Very good sounding comfortable headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money headphone, very comfortable to wear for periods of time and give a good all round sound for the cost
customer_reviews.author: jamie s akister

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the money 😀
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Headphones! Bought for mixing and producing, and out of the box were really comfortable and the sound was well balanced. I am still " burning these in" but am impressed with the frequency response already. Well worth buying, in fact I might stockpile a 2nd pair 😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: After reading multiple reviews I was expecting a lot from these headphones, and they deliver. They are a well balanced and detailed set of cans. The soundstage is excellent, and they're quite comfortable now that they come with velour pads.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely good sound, but random seeminly useless parts start breaking off
customer_reviews.text: 4 months into using these. The sound is good. But the random cheap plastic bits on the sides (there are 4 in total) - 3 of them have already broken off without me doing anything to cause this. Maybe I just got a dodgy pair! All in all they’re good, but definitely cheaply built.
customer_reviews.author: George Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good value headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable headphones with a rich sound. Very good value but perhaps lacking the dynamic sound of more expensive headphones. On balance a very good buy to use with my vinyl record player.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Dav

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are almost perfect. I say almost because they squeeze my head and I have to take them off before I'm finished using them.
customer_reviews.author: Aura Majestik

customer_reviews.title: Lovely sound - I found these headphones far superior to the samson RH600 - a fuller bass sound ...
customer_reviews.text: Lovely sound - I found these headphones far superior to the samson RH600 - a fuller bass sound and more detailed mid & treble and with more life
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for such a low price, I'm using them for studio mixing/referencing and they easily outperform my Shure and AKG models. Possibly not the best choice for general listening, but for audio referencing they are superb.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Birch

customer_reviews.title: Great reference headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones, the sound profile is not coloured, and it gives a good listening profile to mix my audio
customer_reviews.author: OnlyLittleMike

product_meta.title: Samson SR850 Professional Studio Reference Open Back Headphones
product_meta.description:
Samson Professional Studio Reference Headphones provides an outstanding listening solution for musicians, sound engineers and general music enthusiasts alike. With a self-adjusting headband for a secure, natural fit, the SR850s provide total comfort for extended studio sessions. With solid bass response, ultra-clear highs and on open-ear design, the SR850s ensure complete comfort and accurate headphone monitoring. These headphones offer an open-ear design for enhanced ambient listening environment, allowing appropriate bleed for better stereo imaging and a wider sound stage.

The 50mm drivers offer exceptional sound reproduction and wide dynamic range to instil confidence in your final mix or simply provide outstanding sound quality for your general listening pleasure. With a self-adjusting headband for a secure, natural fit, the SR850s provide total comfort for extended studio sessions. An 1/8 inches to 1/4 inches gold-plated adapter is included with the headphones. Whether you're enjoying music or mixing studio tracks, the SR850s offer professional performance and comfort.

BOX CONTAINS
1x Pair of Headphones
feature_bullets: Open ear design for maximum isolation
50 mm drivers for exceptional reproduction and wide dynamic range
